Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Dana W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the way to Phoenix after I got off the train (8 hours late) from Seattle. The rooms was ok. I did like the hardwood floors and the bed, but the bathroom was tiny and sort of dirty. The area was questionable...especially arriving in the middle of the night. Overall, ok for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Close to LA Union train station and Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFaye
Reviews.Content: Central to the stunning LA Union train station and one of LA's sprawling Chinatowns but an expensive ($61US) cab ride from the international airport. My room was upgraded and was large with two double beds, a small table and chairs, a tea and coffee making area, a bathroom with a shower over the bath and a toilet with the handbasin outside the bathroom area. Breakfast is included and is plentiful but unimaginative (e.g. cereals, fruits, muffins, toasts, cold hard boiled eggs, juice). Staff friendly and helpful. Exterior tiles along access balconies very slippery in wet weather. Short walk to cheap restaurants and the beautiful train station.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: Eliza Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of the best western name and seemingly reasonable price, but the tax and charge for parking makes the original listed price much lower than what you end up paying. Rooms are not very nice. Old carpeting, extremely small bathroom, uncomfortable bed and pillows. I definitely will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe Best Western allowed their name to be used here!”
Reviews.Author: RWells5733
Reviews.Content: As a platnum BW rewards member my wife and I have stayed in a lot of Best Western hotels. This however was more of a private hotel on the wrong side of the tracks. As part of the China Town appeal. or to save money they didn't carpet the rooms. The bathroom was not much bigger than the entry door was wide. The room was large, but looked rather emty because of the lack of carpet. When I asked the front desk about an upgrade I got no response. I would not stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “A HOTEL INSIDE THE CHINATOWN”
Reviews.Author: rajeshnsee
Reviews.Content: The biggest advantage of staying in this hotel is the Thai Massage centre located within the same property owned and run by a Thai lady. She rocks. It is a purely genuine place for a very nice and genuine massage at a fairly good price. I had a three hour session there. The rooms in the hotel are horrible, breakfast is from a kiosk and is very substandard. I feel it is a smudge on Best Western's reputation to have given accredition to such properties. The china town is very silent unlike the others and there is no room view at all.

Reviews.Title: “At the gateway to Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: DaddyHoward
Reviews.Content: The little mall at the entrance to Chinatown has a medium size pharmacy, A wellness/massage clinic, a post office, a martial arts studio, a tiny coffee shop that has on offer perhaps 1000 snack and candy offerings as well as pizza and bubble tea, and finally, back in the corner, mostly hidden by the elevator, is the hotel registration office. Ah. The Dragon Gate Inn has a great attitude. It is an aged building (60's or earlier). The rooms are well maintained and comfortable with coffee station and upgraded furnishings. It was entirely suitable to our needs. They offer continental breakfast which, although it is served in the tiny coffee shop in the mall, offers lots of choices including fresh made belgian waffles. All served and manned by cheerful staff who are anxious to please. Our toilet backed up the first time we flushed. The hotel seemed to be expecting this. Almost immediately they sent a man with a snake who had the plumbing back to functioning in moments. I have almost never seen such efficiency. :o) We chose this location because it was the closest property to UnionStation that our travel agent recommended. We left Los Angeles on the Amtrak Coast Starlite. That is a different review.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Darlene C
Reviews.Content: Very close to Union Station, it was a $7 taxi ride from the Amtrak station to the Hotel. Got in late on Saturday night (came down from Canada) and on Sunday morning I needed emergency medical care. Not the easiest thing to find on a Sunday morning in Chinatown, but a nice young man in the Post Office adjacent to the lobby found us a walk-in clinic only a block away where I received excellent care from Dr. Paul Chu. Hotel was also only a couple of blocks from Olvera Street. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western with a Chinese Twist is the Golden Garden of this LA burrow”
Reviews.Author: FlemBrimstone
Reviews.Content: Wow, who knew LA had itâ€™s own Chinatown? Guess a lot of people do, but I think of â€œChinatownâ€� as being a San Francisco treat, not LA. I luckily discovered this place by accident because I wanted a hotel within walking distance of LAâ€™s Amtrak train station. (BTW, Thank you for clicking â€œReview Helpfulâ€� button!) This little Best Western with a Chinese Twist is the Golden Garden of this LA burrow. Room size on the large side, get one of the ones with the bay window for the extra sq ft. In room coffee maker good, average Best Western bath and amenities, bed was the Best Western average comfy with unique Chinese look bedspreads. The room was appointed to the Best Western standard with all Chinese dÃ©cor, quite refreshing and different. My room had hardwood floors, first time Iâ€™ve seen that but it was nice to be able to just glance around and tell things were clean the wood floors could hide no dust or dirt! I wonder why they didnâ€™t choose bamboo? Take an early morning walk or jog. When I started at 8 it looked like any other urban cityscape. By 10 I could have been in a busy street in Hong Kong! Watching the blossom of culture was a sight to see. Boy, was I ever glad I asked the front desk for a good Chinese food recommendation! Just behind this place in the next block is a little secret favorite of celebrities. I saw 2 at lunch! Yang Chow also had really well above average food and valet parking and good prices. The owner greeted everybody like they were a celebrity! In European or International style the Hotelâ€™s Courtyard (that the original Best Western architect no doubt intended for the missing pool) is now a custom feature: All ground floor rooms were converted to small businesses, a pharmacy, an eye Dr. and convenience store/cafÃ© all handy for travelers. The Courtyard has a nice collection of umbrella covered tables and the little convenience store/cafÃ© is where you will get the Best Western continental breakfast. Be sure to get a voucher for each guest when you check in so you do not have to wait at the front desk to get one in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “It ok”
Reviews.Author: freshee61
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and I understand the mixed reviews. You either like it or dont. It's an ok stay.it's pretty clean and continental breakfast it's pretty good. I think it's over priced. The ten dollars parking fee stinks on top of the price. Would I stay again ya but would try to find a better deal especially cause of parking fee. Oh and Free Internet did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Price, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jetkay
Reviews.Content: Love the location. Close to Downtown and Dodger Stadium. Rooms are a little updated. Flat Screen Tvs, iron, coffee maker, fridge :) On the down side the staff wasn't very friendly, people expect a nice staff especially when you are on vacation. Overall, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't love it and I won't be ack”
Reviews.Author: Gary c
Reviews.Content: I booked by telephone, Sunday afternoon, for Sunday night. The quoted rate was $117.99 plus taxes. When I got there, they informed me that there was a $10.00 a night parking fee. There was no other parking available. I asked for a 6am alarm. It did not happen. He appoligized and said he forgot. They offered a Continental breakfast. At 6:30am, I asked where it was. He stated that it did not open untill 7:15am and it was down the block a few doors. This is the only hotel that I have ever stayed in that did not start the breakfast at least by 6am. Most business people are on the road by 7am. The room was clean and in nice condition.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place for a family”
Reviews.Author: JACKSON12345660763
Reviews.Content: The personnel at the front desk were so helpful and friendly. We only stayed there for a night but they went out of thier way to help us. For example: providing a map from the hotel to the station, storing our luggage, dialling for a cab and generally chatting with us to provide us info about LA. The room was as advertise. Neat and clean and big enough for the 4 of us to fit in along with our luggage. The free breakfast was wholesome. I'll certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Book the "Dragon Suite!"”
Reviews.Author: catta123
Reviews.Content: Only the Dragon Suite was available when I booked the hotel so I was a bit reluctant. The hotel had come highly recommended to me by colleagues, however, so I booked it. What a pleasant surprise! A REAL suite separated by a REAL door between the living room and bedroom with a large TV in each. Each room also had individually controlled AC units which was also a big plus. A very comfortable bed made for a very restful sleep. And then to walk in to the bathroom and find a separate shower and WHIRLPOOL spa. Ahhhhh! I was on a pleasure trip this time, but knowing they have free internet access and a breakfast available, I will definitely book this hotel on my next business trip. And with it's central location, i might even bring along some of the family, too. Thank you, staff, for a wonderful visit!

Reviews.Title: “rooms”
Reviews.Author: annchan0806
Reviews.Content: Compare to the room rate, I think it's quite ok. The rooms were big enough for two persons in 1 room. All facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “No bars in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: DaveyJA
Reviews.Content: Great location, very central and only 5 minutes from Union Street station where we arrived on an Amtrak. Easy to get to metro or buses for visits to Hollywood, Universal Studios etc. Possible to walk to downtown area in 15/20 minutes. Chinatown was nice to wander around and had a couple of nice meals but nowhere to just have a local drink and no sign of a bar or other food other than Chinese. We were there for a week so found it a bit boring after a while. Had a nice meal at Traax in the station but otherwise had to go downtown. Hotel was fine, breakfast OK but almost certainly had English money stolen out of my purse while we were there which I didn't realise until we got home. Rooms at the hotel were a good size and had no other complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in Chinatown!”
Reviews.Author: shibobuta
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my trip to Los Angeles - I needed a place to stay that was close to downtown LA but also everywhere else since I needed to make the most out of my short weekend. We arrived late at night and the clerk was very nice. The room was clean and spacious, more so than expected from reading reviews. This is nothing like Chinatown in SF - it's so much cleaner, the people are nicer, and transportation was easy to get to. We also stumbled into a few bars, jazz bars, etc that were pretty happening. There seems to be a pretty large nightlife underground art scene with lots of hipsters. People were really nice and friendly. I really liked my room too - the decorations were cute. I liked that one wall was painted red... kind of made it more oriental looking. The old posters were cool too! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Danger!! Proceed With Caution!!!!!!!Two Thumbs Down!”
Reviews.Author: MsNR1029
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay at this hotel if someone was holding a gun to my head!! First of all, we booked this room last minute b/c it was "downtown" and the rate was $99. Upon check-in, we were informed that we had to pay $10 to park. We had no choice since there is virtually no parking along the street. The underground parking is tiny and horrible! All the spaces were full, so the attendant had to park us in the disabled parking space (without a placard). After I checked in, I went upstairs to the room only to find a man and woman leaving out of the same room! I went back downstairs and demanded they give me a different room. The clerk changed my room to 205. On my way back upstairs, some random guy with tattoos on his head asked me if he can hide out in my room!!! He followed me halfway to my room telling me that he was running from the police and asking for shelter!! WTF?? I also couldn't sleep because I heard EVERYTHING going on in the next room!! I ended up leaving the same night I checked in...cutting my losses. When I returned home and checked my bank account, I found that I had been charged twice for one nights stay. One charge for the room+tax and one charge for the room+tax and parking. I called the hotel to let them know. The same clerk answered and denied the mistake. I spoke with a manger "Tony" who said he will "check into it" and call me back. As of this review, I am still waiting for the call back. I eneded up filing a claim with my bank. DANGER!!!!!PROCEED WITH CAUTION!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay despite first impressions”
Reviews.Author: pointless_parasite
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dragon Gate for two nights after arriving in LA at Union Station which is about 15 minutes walk away. The neighborhood seamed fairly safe although not very vibrant compared to chinatown areas in other cities. Initial impressions weren't good at all though. It's an ugly concrete building arranged around a courtyard and the whole place appeared dark and deserted. I hit a small gong on the desk in reception and a member of staff soon appeared and checked me in. My room was on the first floor and was pitch black. The corridor was badly lit as well, so I spent what seamed like several minutes fumbling around trying to find the light switch. Eventually I used the glow from my MP3 player to locate the bathroom light, and subsequently found the main room light switch in a cupboard. Why did they put it in there?? Despite this, the room was actually really nice and tastefully decorated with a few chinese touches. The coffee made using the machine tasted absolutely vile, which I presume was the fault of the coffee maker itself as the tap water tasted fine. Breakfast is actually served in a shop in the courtyard (you get a voucher when checking in). The staff there were seriously miserable. Choice was really limited compared to other Best Western hotels. Just a few cereals, bread, cakes and ugly looking bananas, although they can make you waffels if you ask. Location isn't bad. It's perhaps 20 minutes walk into the city centre and there is a metro station just around the corner. The Dragon Gate hotel was much cheaper than any alternatives in central LA, so if you can put up with the ugly exterior I'd definately recommend it. All the hotel staff I spoke to were friendly and helpful and the rooms themselves are clean, quiet and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “The Room Actually Looked Like The Pictures!”
Reviews.Author: MissDiaz-7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the BW Dragon Gate. We booked a QQ room with a rollaway, and I called beforehand to verify that there would be enough room for the rollaway bed in the room. There was more than enough room for the 4 of us and the room we had (3rd floor) was well-decorated and comfortable. Not luxe by any means, but for $120/nt., we felt it was a good value. There was a small issue with the toilet fixture, but the sole desk attendant (it was late) promptly took care of it. Overall, service was good, and the dining options in the area are very good, if you like Chinese. Our favorite meal was at Master Chef, just a couple blocks up Hill St. from the hotel. The free breakfast is served out of the deli/cafe at the front of the plaza- it's nothing much- but if you can make do with cereal/bagels/toast/muffins and occasionally fruit, it's fine. There are waffles, but the clerk makes them one at a time behind the counter and I'm not patient enough for that. Union Station is about a 10-minute walk from the hotel- from there you can take the Metro for $1.50 each way- very convenient. Free wi-fi and a computer for use in the (miniscule) lobby are an added plus. The wi-fi is not reliable in all rooms, however; I had to go to the courtyard for a good signal. The fitness center is a joke, but that was no problem as we walked several miles each day sightseeing. Overall, it was good enough for our purposes- safe, roomy and reasonable. Next time, we'll spend more and stay in a different hotel, but that doesn't mean this one's bad.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice close to Union Station”
Reviews.Author: Don31
Reviews.Content: The staff was very welcoming and the room we were given was way more than we expected. We were referred to the Master Chef Restaurant and had outstanding food and service. The taxi fare varied from $6 to $7.50.

Reviews.Title: “Remember to bring your bedroom slippers!”
Reviews.Author: castlerock94538
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in China Town which makes it easy to get to downtown, Hollywood and just about every where else. Parking is basically 'valet', so if you are fussy about someone else parking your car there's a public parking garage across the street. Checking in experience was an eye opener, the Front Office staff wont stand to greet you nor will he answer the ringing phone although he will answer his cell phone whilst attending to you and the let the desk phone continue ringing. The elevator will require a room key to gain access to the guest rooms which is nice but the card reader is erratic and will require some patience...hopefully you wont get mugged in the process. The room is ...ok, lets put it this way, it sure looked better when i woke up at 2am in the dark- startled by voices from the folks next door - who sounded like they were in my room. The carpets really need a good shampoo , furniture dusted, bathroom bleached and air freshened. They can also use some new towels, the holes and fray are ok but the shades of white to grey really scared me.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: rollergirlusa
Reviews.Content: Looks nothing like the website. Filthy! Carpet and bedding are nasty, bathtub clogged with hair/dirt. Front desk consists of 1 person sitting in a chair watching a television at full blast that sits right on the check-in counter. Commode overflowed and when I told front desk he handed me a plunger!? Really? Bugs everywhere, saw rats downstairs. This is the worst place I have ever stayed. Room with ice machine was so full of boxes and trash we could not even get to the machine - waist high!

Reviews.Title: “won't recommended”
Reviews.Author: baby2carol
Reviews.Content: the service since i walked there was terrible , couldn't do much because was purchased in expedia, taking the copy of ID is against the law but the recepcionist was arguing with me with a really nasty attitude, call her manager, her plus didn't want to give the complementary breaksfast that was suppost to give every morning, well honestly didn't like it at all for that rather go to metro hotel wich is wayyyyyyyyyyy better and for the same price

Reviews.Title: “Loud and in a bad area”
Reviews.Author: raevyn007
Reviews.Content: Not in a very good area. Really didn't feel safe. The elevator's inspection date (as posted in the elevator) was over a year expired as well. This hotel is on a very busy street and it was VERY loud in my room with the traffic all night long. It woke me up several times. I ended up leaving early and finding another hotel. I would NOT advise anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “I did not like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramsejheavenlyus
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel by internet based on the photos and reviews, and its was quite a dissapointment. The only thing nice about this hotel was the room, its very confortable and clean. I actually like the decorations of the room. Although the continetal breakfast was included, did not like the fact that you have to go to Hill Street Cafe to get it. They give you a red card for breakfast which you have to give back at breakfast. I actually was asked if I was going to pay for my breakfast after giving my red card. The service was more or less fine. They were nice at the front desk (except for one person), but could not give more information regarding places to go. The internet connection is really slow. The location is not bad, is centrally located, everything is by walking distance. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kathiejmie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to LA for two weeks and needed a hotel in Downtown, so some people from a travel forum suggested Dragon Gate. The hotel was quite cheep (we paid the internet rate of $70 per night). The staff were very friendly and helpful. The check-in and check-out procedures were very quick. The hotel offers complementary breakfast in a small cafe, the breakfast is simple but very nice and they make great waffles. The rooms are clean and quiet. We didn't rent a car but you can go practically everywhere by bus or Metro rail. There's a bus stop near the entrance and the Union station is just a ten-minute walk (Chinatown station is much closer but we prefered to walk). The neighborhood is safe and there are many nice restaurants. If I ever come to LA again, I'd definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place To Stay Near Downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: codewarrior
Reviews.Content: This week I went to Los Angeles for a convention. Since I needed to be downtown near the Convention Center, a friend suggested the Best Western in Chinatown. Since I like Chinese food and the culture, I went for it. Well, it was cool. The rooms were clean and quiet. The rates were reasonable. The service was great, friendly. Thereâ€™s free WIFI, very important for me. Chinatown has several excellent restaurants close by - including my favorite, The Golden Dragon. In the evening some friends and I checked out L.A. LIVE only a few minutes away from the Convention Center. Lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: johnny_07656
Reviews.Content: After staying two nights at the Royal Pagoda motel just a block or two away, we moved to this hotel because we couldn't get anymore nights at the other one. Also, the rates were very good thru Expedia. Our stay was great. I was traveling with two of my friends, so we were three guys just vacationing in L.A. The check-in (and check-out) were the worst experiences of the whole trip. There are a couple of kids working the desk that seem to just take their sweet time and don't acknowledge that another guest is waiting to be checked in. They're friendly enough, kind of quiet actually. But they are slow. Very slow. It took more than 15 minutes for the person in front of me to finish and then it took them at least 5 full minutes to check me in. They would always disappear to the back office and not reappear for several minutes. The check-out was almost as slow at the end of our stay. At check-in, the guy didn't give us the complimentary breakfast tickets as he gave to the other guest he checked in. That might be because we had a low rate thru Expedia, I don't know. When I asked, he only gave us one ticket each when we really needed two each for each day of our stay. A couple days later, when I needed a ticket, I went to the front desk and told them we had only gotten one each at check-in, and the person there gave me another ticket right away, so it wasn't that big a deal in the end; it was just unsettling at check-in to only get the one ticket each. Aside from the slow and slightly unprofessional (but not very bad) check-in the hotel was a great place to stay. The hotel is in a small complex of shops and it is organized around a courtyard where the shops are. I thought this was a great arrangement. One of the shops in the courtyard serves the complimentary breakfast. They had good coffee, a few danishes, bagels, english muffins, some fruit, and the person at the counter would offer you a waffle when you hand in the ticket for the free breakfast. The waffle was good, nothing spectacular, but good. Same goes for everything else. I saw nothing that was "moldy" as another reviewer experienced. Everything seemed very fresh. The room was a good size and had TV, a table with a couple chairs, a desk with its own chair, and free wireless internet. The internet was no problem, I just started up my laptop and was on the internet - no codes or passwords or anything. Worked great, too, helped us find a restaurant for dinner and a couple bars to hit afterwards. The beds were good, bathroom was very good, no problems with shower or water pressure, no problems with drainage in the tub, everything was fine. It was very, very clean also. We even used the in-room coffee maker and that was great also. The sink was just outside the bathroom but still in a separated area and this was convenient as others could use the sink while someone else was showering. The maids were very accommodating and they did a great job with the room, it was very clean. They were very friendly also. This hotel has all exterior corridors as others have mentioned; however, in this case, I found it to be a positive. It was nice to step outside and get some air (or for those who smoke, to smoke). All exterior corridors overlooked the courtyard which was nice. And, even though the hallways are outdoors, the elevator (which needs to be taken for any room) has a slide so that you must swipe your valid key card or else it won't go to your floor, so that added a level of security and helped put me a little more at ease. The neighborhood is Chinatown. Even though it is part of downtown it is a very safe area. We never felt threatened or in danger at all. The people are nice and it's an interesting area. You can sightsee right in that neighborhood and there are interesting shops to visit and there is GREAT food. I'm used to Chinatown in NYC where we have great Chinese food, but L.A.'s chinatown is definitely just as good, if not better. The parking is a weird situation. There is a parking garage under the hotel. The hotel will charge you $8 a night to park there, and from what I've heard they will require you "valet" park the car. My friends and I are not big on valets because we want to be able to just get in and go without waiting for some valet. So we didn't go with their parking. We parked on the street which was free and fine all weekend long. We parked overnight with no problems. During the day we were out and about so we didn't park there. On the Weekdays the meters kick in. Anyway, we parked for free at night every night on the street. On Monday morning when we were going to check out, I had to move the car by 8 AM. The garage that does the valet parking is open to the public and charges a flat $3 rate for the day, so I just moved the car there till we left later in the morning (no valet, it was self park). Overall, it was a good stay. The room was much nicer than the Royal Pagoda nearby, and the rates were good but not as low as the Royal Pagoda. Overall this is a simple hotel, and it's great for vacationers who aren't going to spend a ton of time in their hotel room. If I traveled to L.A. on business I probably wouldn't stay here, at least not more than a night or two. I will definitely look to stay here again on my next vacation to L.A. though. Chinatown is a great location - it's safe, it's interesting, great food options (including bakeries that make awesome pastries for breakfast), and located near all the major freeways so you can easily get anywhere you want. Everywhere we wanted to go was only about 10 minutes away - Hollywood, Pasadena, Venice, etc. I'd recommend this place to any of my friends and I will hopefully stay there again. The only thing is that I've noticed their rates to get pretty high, and at that point I'd considering staying in a nicer hotel like a Hilton or something. But for under $80 a night it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great if all you need is a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: calinite17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the middle of Chinatown, just north of Los Angeles' downtown. As far as location goes, you can't get much better as most any place is accessible by car. It's near the 10, 5, 101 and 110 freeways. On the other hand, the immediate surroundings aren't the best, but typical of the Los Angeles downtown area (not including the few blocks where all the tall buildings are). The room was a good size and clean. The building is a little drabby. The breakfast comes out of a small convenience store located on the first floor (free). Also located on the first floor, strip-like mall area are some other Chinese shops. Overall, I was satisfied with my experience there (but then, all I was looking for was a place to stay).

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL IN HISTORY”
Reviews.Author: CANTBELlEVEIT
Reviews.Content: Their customer service was beyond rude! (They are cold blooded liars) I don't have words that can describe my experience that I had encountered. I asked prior to making reservations if they had Internet connection and they told me "yes" I go there the same day pay for my room go upstairs and guess what the internet was having issues NO INTERNET ( that just took the word "business" out of "business trip") I Called down to ask them to help me with the details of the internet( maybe I was doing something wrong) I rudely got shut down with a " I dont know anything you call number on card in room" Okay.....? that was weird. Continued to call tech support, tech support says the router at the hotel needs to be reset ,he'll just call them to do that and the internet should be up and running in about5 minutes. So I decide to take a shower and 45 minutes later I try the internet NOPE! still doesnt work. Call tech support again and tech support checks and says oh thats odd they didnt reset their router yet ( like they told them they would ) Okay since the hotel wasnt helping or trying he was going to connect me manually that was complicated but it was done. Of course 10 minutes later I lost it. So as I call back tech support i realize I can sort of pick up the neighbors wireless if I stand half way in the bathroom and the sink area . Tech support tells me that I wont be able to get Internet do to too many people on just one line usually they have 4 but 3 of them are down and the hotel doesnt know how to reset their router. Okay..?....so now what well I get a big I'm sorry IM SORRY WHAT ABOUT MY TRAVELING AcROSS THE STATE THE WHOLE dAY AND NOW YOUR TELLING ME SORRY! What happen to yes we have internet ! It should be we have Internet for the first 20 people that arrive! I then tell tech support to try to make this right an if they can call down stairs and try to do something. 2 minutes later I get a call and they say HOTEL:So you have a problem with the internet? ME: yes I asked you if you had internet and you said yes what happened? HOTEL: I don't know you want I move you to another room ME: I wont have internet over there either HOTEL: Yes you will ME: I asked tech support and they said I wont HOTEL:I dont know you move or no ME: No I want you to reset your router and fix the issue HOTEL: I dont know nothing I cant help you then ME: why are you going to tell me you internet when 3 out of your 4 lines are down HOTEL: You no ask us that ME: yes I did HOTEL: No you did not must be misunderstanding ME: um NO *************************** very small verbal altercation ********************* ME:you are very rude I want to talk to your superior HOTEL; No they not here you talk to them on Tuesday (4 days form then) ME: I will not be here on Tuesday and how will that help HOTEL:I call them and call you back ****************************************10 minutes later*********************** HOTEL: I talk to boss he said pack your things and get out we give you refund ME: What are you kicking me out HOTEL: yes you have 20 minutes ME: ??????????????? I dont know what the heck just happened there I have never in my life got kick out of hotel or treated so unreasonably. I think I hate this place get my money and get some where else that will treat me like a paying customer. I pack go to the ugly lobby and demand my money. HOTEL: no we no give you money back ,you too much trouble we dont want you here. ME:HUH ?!! you said you'll give me my money back if I leave now! HOTEL:No, leave now good bye ME:I have no where to stay HOTEL:your room has been rented out to somebody else now ME: You deceived me and took my money HOTEL:too bad good BYE I cant believe what is happening. I left called best western corp. thank god they compensated me and made things right. But that short brief stay traumatised me forever DONT STAY THERE save your selves dont let what happen to me happen to you!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: tourista-3
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was nice. Room was clean but small. The location was good. The outside of the building is a bit run down. Overshadowing the acceptable aspects of this hotel is the most terrible breakfast, the filthy cafe and patio. The first dilemma is deciding whether you can eat the food from the cafe and not get sick. The milk sits on the counter in it's original carton (no ice, no refrigeration); the hardcooked eggs are warm leaving you wondering if they're just freshly made or how many days have they been sitting on the counter. The counters are so crowded with "stuff" that you can't really see what this breakfast includes. The second difficult decision is deciding which dirty table to sit at in the courtyard. The courtyard floor holds years of dirt, the walls are stained, the garbage cans almost unapproachable. It's difficult to breathe because the courtyard is filled with local old men smoking and filling out their lotto tickets. Disgusting place. I absolutely do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “International flavor and a cute courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: Bixchick
Reviews.Content: I loved this little hotel! It was more like international travel than like being in L.A. The hotel is in chinatown on the 2nd and 3rd floor of a building with a cute courtyard with tables and Chinese businesses on the first floor. The room was huge, very clean, modern and very quiet. Our windows faced out with a view of downtown. Being in chinatown was great as there were a lot of interesting shops and street activity. We wished we had more time to spend but were on a business trip. The staff was extremely helpful and found us parking for our 15' truck at a neighboring motel for free. I would definitely stay here again if I needed to stay in downtown L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: megs22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group of friends. We where on a budget so this was a great choice. The rooms where very clean, large, the beds where comfortable. It's located in chinatown, and a little far from the main attractions, but in LA you have to rent a car to get to where your going, so it wasn't that bad. The breakfast is good. Loved the waffles and enjoy the fortune cookies at the reception area. I would recommend this hotel. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Desirable place...”
Reviews.Author: davedmd
Reviews.Content: We needed to attend a convention and the other hotels were overpriced. This one was not cheap for the money and the breakfast was a joke. The staff is nice and helpfull. All the rooms are on the 2nd and third floor. You need a room key to go up the elevator and we felt secured with this as not everyone could go upstairs. The parking is discounted to $8/day insted of the usuall $10. THe room was soundproofed pretty well. It was dark and dreary. It was clean but nothing to get excited about, depressing when I think how much I had to pay for it. The balcony door in the room did not make a tight seal around the fram which leaked air and bugs or flys. I went out bought tape and taped up the entire door fram to make a perfect seal. The maid was extremly ruid and on the last day kept knocking for us to leave even though we had 3 more hours to check out. The lobby everyday is filled with chinese old timers who sit and chain smoke and play soe type of lotto there. It looks like a retiremnt home for the chinese there, not a hotel. The other advantage is your next to some good chinese restaurants, if you like chinese food. I wouldnt stay here again, I would avoid china town as there aren't any decent hotels here.

Reviews.Title: “NeedShirtReturned”
Reviews.Author: FreeChoice1
Reviews.Content: I had a written confirmation that clearly stated the price after all taxes and fees, but then the hotel tried charging $8 more. Parking is $3 if you rent the room directly from the hotel, but they add an additional $5 parking fee if you reserve through outside sources such as internet sites. The room was okay, but my friend left a valuable shirt in the room and we called about it that same day. We would have returned for the shirt, but the hotel has thus far refused to return it despite several calls. I cannot recommend a hotel where it may take legal action to obtain the return of a shirt. Finders keepers will not apply to this situation. I spend over 200 nights per year at hotels and have never experienced anything like that at any other location. A staff member who will not return a shirt is not someone I want to have a key to my door while I am out eating.

Reviews.Title: “Comforable, clean, pleasant”
Reviews.Author: dkuhlman
Reviews.Content: Very nice motel. If you want to be near downtown Los Angeles, this is a good location. It was quite, clean, and pleasant. It was not upscale, but was a comfortable place to stay. The location in Chinatown adds color. The breakfast is actually a token that you use in a very small shop located in the same courtyard. There was quite a bit of variety of things to eat, but very limited places to sit. We enjoyed it. And, the people working at the motel were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: shadrachsmom
Reviews.Content: I paid about $70/night for a room and I thought it was a great value! The hotel is close to downtown LA and very convenient to the 101. I felt very safe and comfortable. There is a valet parking garage for $8/night, the rooms are large, clean and comfortable, and the continental breakfast is great. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An Okay Place If You Are Chinese!”
Reviews.Author: Londontraveller84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend. It was ok the chinese people where very nice but the language barrier was a problem. A very basic hotel and it served its purpose. Won't be staying in Los Angeles again as it is a bit of a dump. San Diego is a better place to stay in. Its only an hour drive from Los Angeles and its very beautiful there. Los Angeles has a lot of poor people who beg for money just ignore them. Chinatown is very empty at night, its on the east of Los Angeles so its not far from the rough areas. If you are going to visit Los Angeles then i would stay in Beverley Hills or Bel- Air. They are the best areas, its worth paying the extra few dollars to stay somewhere nice. Everywhere else in Los Angeles is pretty rundown. I was very dissapointed. The Best Western Dragon Gate Inn Motel is ideal if you are just looking for a cheap bed for a couple of nights. The rooms are very clean and the handyman is always on site if you need him. Try it for yourself if you dare!

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderingVFamily
Reviews.Content: We were going to San Francisco on the Amtrak via Union Station. Since our train was leaving early in the morning we wanted to stay down in LA overnite. The Dragon Gate Inn served its purpose. It was close to Union Station, it was relatively clean and the staff was nice. The parking lot attendant on duty the day we were there was a gem, he parked our car for us and was very helpful with information we needed. I would stay here again if we were leaving out of Union Station.

Reviews.Title: “What a Delight!”
Reviews.Author: loveslifesandiego
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel last year and returned this weekend...We had a family emergency, and had to fly back East. Returning to the west coast we stayed overnight before we took the train to San Diego..The room was spotless..Had a beautiful new flat screen T.V....Coffee maker...iron....etc...The people at the front desk were cordial and friendly..We enjoyed the hotel last year, but this year there were new updates to the furnishings, including the flat screen T.V....There is a wonderful seafood restaurant nearby that is beautiful with delicious food! I believe it was called Ocean Seafood...We walked to the Goldline, and then took the Amtrak back to San Diego..Thank goodness we had a restful night, in a lovely room,and efficient and personable service.following a very stressful week taking care of my parents who were in ill health...... Melody and Dave Miller

Reviews.Title: “By far the worst experience I had with a hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler123SF
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sat Dec. 23 at around midnight (after 6 hours of driving) and booked 3 nights through one of Expedia's companies. We booked a 2 bed room. After we checked in and got the keys, we found that the elevator was broken, we were on the 3rd floor. After we when through the dusty stairs to the 3rd floor with our luggage and got into our room, we got the surprise that it was a 1bed room. I called the counter, and only then, the person in the counter acknowledged that we got a 1 bed room and offered a roller bed. Only one caveat, I had to go downstairs to help him out to carry the roller bed to the 3rd floor! After I did that, we realized we had no sheets and a blanket for the roller bed. I called again, and I had to go to pick up sheets and a blanket from a closet. After all of that, we just wanted to take a shower and sleep. Then we realized that the bathroom door did not lock! Then after that, we realized that one of the pillows in the master bed had a black stain on the other side of the pillow. It was 1am already, we really wanted to leave at that moment, but decided to stay for the night. The following morning we wanted to check out after such a terrible experience. We explained to the new person in the counter what happened the previous night and he understood and told us we could check out. We left and continued with our vacation in another hotel. Later on, I realized that I was charged for the other 2 nights I did not stay in the hotel (I booked through Expedia unfortunately). Expedia did not want to refund me for the 2 nights because I canceled early and already issued a payment to the hotel (even though there were good reasons to do so.) To my surprise, the hotel is ALSO unwilling to refund the money to Expedia so that Expedia can consider refunding me. Overall, I got the worst experience I had in a hotel, and Expedia and the Best Western Dragon Gate still profited from 2 nights I did not use. Customer loses, Company wins. The only thing I can do now is to help other people AVOID this kind of situation. Stay away from the Dragon Gate if you can, it is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: aazaleaa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Chinatown!! Quiet, very clean and nicely decorated. Very secure. The fluffiest pillows I've ever seen in a "budget" hotel! Fast check in, friendly and courteous staff. Convenient to freeway and easy to get in & out of. Also, really good price for L.A. Only drawback, there was only 3 cable channels to choose from, but no big deal. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “only if you get it cheap”
Reviews.Author: theauditor
Reviews.Content: Although I asked for a non-smoking room, I got a smoking room based on the smell and the ashtray that I noticed too late. The room was very large but in very poor condition. The hotel advertises free internet but I was not able to use it all night. It came on in the morning. The otherwise nice lady at the reception during checkout dismissed that it was the service of a provider company and not her problem. The room is not well kept, towels were clean but I still am not sure about the bedding. It does not help to have yellow pillow cases (I trust they were designed yellow). Finally, the breakfast they advertise is probably yesterdays pastries from the shelves of a nearby convenience store which serves coffee in tiny cups with just sugar (not even the pink sweet'n low). So disregard free internet and free breakfast from the value proposition. On the positive, the location is very convenient:in the middle of Chinatown and very close to downtown LA which may get a lot more expensive. Chinatown also feels safer. I got it on Expedia for about $55 plus $7 for parking. Streets are no parking at 7 am so you have to pay if you will stay past that.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual but Pleasant Motel in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2 nights at the Dragon Gate Inn--largely because many fancier hotels in LA were full (I believe because of LA Fashion Week). The Dragon Gate was perfectly pleasant, if externally unattractive. My room was bigger than motel standard--it had a large seating area and vaguely Chinese furnishings. Plenty of lights, good darkness, but some noise from Hill Street, which is a major bus corridor (one could reasonably stay here without a car). The second night I just ran the fan and drowned it out, as I've done in many hotels. The whole ground floor, except for a small lobby, is given over to small shops--florist, convenience store, clothing store etc.--and an atrium seating area. This motel is much more part of its neighborhood than most. One drawback is that LA's Chinatown, unlike San Francisco's or New York's, mostly closes early, so don't count on midnight meals here. My only complaint was that the chain above the lock was broken and they didn't fix it, though I asked. The lock had a deadbolt so it was no biggie, but I didn't like it. Apart from this I'd say the desk was brusque but efficient.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got there early at 9am. even though check in was 3pm. they let me have my room. Cleanest room I've ever had. Coffee pot with all the fix-ens, plenty of ice. Beautiful view from the window. Ice cold A/C. Quiet. Small shops for Chinese shopping. Everyone very, very friendly. Price was great. At the Deli get the Ham & Corn Beef with Swiss . U.S. Post Office on site .Free internet at Deli. All around AAA+

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: SF2006
Reviews.Content: I thought to stay here because I loved Chinatown and some of the reviews here said it was OK. Ignore those reviews! My opinion: This "hotel" was really a motel. The place was dirty and there were lottery sheets floating all over the ground because of the old men trying to hit their numbers downstairs at the convenience store where you get your "continental breakfast". That's right; you get your breakfast at something akin to a 7-11. But not as nice as 7-11. The room was dirty, stains on the wall which looked like coffee or wine or who knows what. The carpet was very old and you didnâ€™t want your bare feet on it. The bed was uncomfortable. The room was full of flies. Lots of dark areas in the common walkway for creepy people to hide. Women may not feel safe walking there alone. The reception staff person was horribly rude and aggressive. Completely unpleasant stay. Seriously, in my opinion, I would not advise anyone to stay there. This is not a nice experience. It will ruin your time in LA. After staying there I actually want to avoid Chinatown now!

Reviews.Title: “Had A Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dragon Gate Inn during a recent visit to the Los Angeles area. I found the accomodations quite comfortable. I paid around $100 for the room and found it well worth the money. The rooms are very spacious, and quiet. This hotel is located in trendy Chinatown. There is a abundance of restaurants, as well as shopping. I was able to pick up some nice chinese dresses and trinkets for my daughters and friends back in Illinois. Overall, my stay at the Dragon Gate Inn was great.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: supermanx
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel in LA and unable to compare to other hotels in LA but satisfactory is all that I can say. I think that LA hotels are like London hotels in that you need to pay a lot of money if you are looking for a really nice hotel.The 3 star ones aren't really that much to look at but a place to stay cheaply and relatively well located downtown. The exterior, quite old and a bit dingy Rooms: Clean but V.dated interiors Amenities: Don't expect much as there wasn't any. No restaurant, No fitness centre but a room with a few dusty weights Surroundings: In Chinatown LA which is a surprisingly quiet part of town. Parking: Was USD7/night in the underground parking beneath the hotel Service: family run business so all staff seemed Chinese which is ok

Reviews.Title: “Stay here every year!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel every year over the Chinese New Year Celebration weekend. The hotel is right on the parade route and in walking distance of dozens of great Chinese Restaurants. The hotel is an average hotel with great staff. The rooms are clean and large and in good condition. There are individual climate controls in each room and a refrigerator. We are given a voucher for a complimentry beverage and a pastry or bagel at the deli downstairs. This is all we need for breakfast. The staff has always been helpful and friendly and this year will be our 5th year in a row staying here. For the money it's a great location and a clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Your Friendly Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JasmineB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dragon Gate Inn for 8 days and enjoyed our stay there. I loved the neighborhood feel of the hotel's atrium where locals gather for chitchat and coffee and where you get your free breakfast. The hotel is in a convenient location in Chinatown, near bus stops and many Chinese restaurants. Hotel staff are friendly, though I didn't find them very helpful as they could not give very good directions for travelling to some LA tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient, and Safe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Dragon Gate Inn for four nights during the summer in Los Angeles. I choose the Dragon Gate Inn based on the reviews from tripadvisor. We were more than pleased during our entire stay. The rooms are fairly large and good for the kids. The area was very nice because the hotel was in the middle of chinatown los angeles. The location was roughly about 20 minutes from most of the attractions that we went to. Food was widely available during all hours of the day. The continental breakfast was also very nice, be sure to try the made to order waffles. In addition, the hotel offers a computer for the guests to access email and surf the net for free. So you really do not need to drag your heavy laptop around. All in all the experience was quite wonderfu.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, safe, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: KazzieDy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we wanted to be able to visit Chinatown quite easily. Staff were extremely helpful and couteous, I even received a gift because it was the managers birthday whilst I was there. Good local restaurants (including the one from the Jackie Chan film "Rush Hour" - excellent food!), very safe area. Bit of a hike to the nearest tube, but once there, no problems and felt quite safe. Hotel was clean and comfortable and there was an excellent Chinese supermarket close by. Internet worked all the time and was very fast, TV was good, fridge very useful. Toilet did block up once but was fixed within 30 minutes. Good size room overall. No complaints at all and would definately stay again but note that restaurants seem to close about 9pm which, being from England, we found very strange as we're used to going out to eat around 8.30pm.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't wait to check out...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pretty dissapointed when we checked into this hotel considering that I had such high expectations having read most of its reviews. The room was very spacious alright but it stank. I could not tell what caused this stinky smell but it definitely smelled "Unfresh". I even developed a throat irritation after having stayed the first night... (and i get this when there's too much dust). The carpet was terrible. It looked and felt dirty that I couldn't go barefoot at all. Imagine a sticky icky feeling when you step on it. The sheets smelled okay but it had small holes in them. The airconditioning system was old and gave out a strange noise once it was turned on. The bathroom was small. No tub, just a shower with no area to put our bath essentials on so i had to place my shampoo/conditioner on the floor while bathing. The vanity area/sink was very small and had rusty stains. The parking area was at the basement which i considered very inconvenient as guests have to lug their baggages all the way down. Good thing they had an elevator. Breakfast was the worst part. They had a very limited choice of pastries and we had to pay for all the rest. I couldn't wait to check out from the minute i checked in. Save for the courteous and accomodating staff, I have nothing else good to say about the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Garment Buyers Favorite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to Los Angeles about twice a month and I just recently stayed at the Best Western Dragon Gate Inn. They gave me a great deal because I am a clothing buyer. Be sure to ask for the Garment Buyer rate. I should not tell you folks the rate, just call and ask. The rooms are very spacious and hold a lot of the merchandise that I buy. Also, be sure to try there waffles in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Smells!!”
Reviews.Author: princessj96
Reviews.Content: I hate to have to write this, but I had based all the hotels I booked for my travels on reviews such as these. I personally would not stay at this hotel again, we even checked out early as it was dampening our stay in LA. The staff I found were very rude, not sure if the English/Chinese-American language barrier was getting in the way but the staff seemed not to like us much. On checking in they pulled faces at us wanting to pay by travellers cheque, and dragged the whole checking-in thing on for about 30 minutes, this at 1am is never a good start. The room was a good size although there was a musty type smell, and the room never seemed light even with the curtains drawn and lights on. There was a lot of noise from outside. Location wise it was ok, the walk to Union Station is pretty, the restaurants are close by although I would advise a delivery as I never felt safe walking out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good and most importantly Safe”
Reviews.Author: NextChapterTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dragon Inn because of the great reviews on this site. I wasn't dissapointed. This is a safe, clean and spacious place to stay if you want to stay close to DownTown LA. It's really hard to find a safe area to spend the night but also be close to the Downtown core in the morning. The DASH and METRO bus stops are both just around the block so you can take the bus downtown in less than 10 minutes. The bus ride towards downtown is along the financial district so its also very safe. We stayed at the BW Mayfair on the other side of town last time and the area was just totally unsafe and outright scary... I had initial concerns that the surrounding area may be "ghetto" or dangerous. But it was very safe and we could go out at night for a decent meal for a good price at many of the Chinese restaurants just below. The facilities and service are above average. Rooms were spacious and well equipped. The staff was super nice and helpful so you won't feel alone at all if you are new to LA, you can ask them tons of questions. I would have to say that the breakfast is probably the only thing misleading. It consists of a coffee/tea and a commercial baked pastry that you redeem at the corner store downstairs. Bring your own breakfast if you are a picky breakfast person... I would definitely stay at the Dragon Inn the next time I come to LA. I have to stay near the Downtown Core for business so this is the safest place to stay that is conveniently located only 10 minutes away.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Dragon Gate Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 818 North Hill Street, Los Angeles, CA 90012
